sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含有"自夸，吹嘘"之意。
means: boast ： 普通用词，指对自己所做的事，自己的长处、财富以及家庭等的夸耀，常含言过其实的意味。
brag ： 非正式用词，其夸耀和吹嘘意味强于boast，到了过分夸大，有时令人讨厌的地步。
crow ： 多指大声吵嚷地吹嘘，夸耀自己做某事比他人做得好。
pride ： 与boast的意义较接近，指炫耀、夸口，自鸣得意，常与反身代词连用。

sentence.Network_cn: 他在黑板上写了一个大大的单词pride。

sentence.Network_en: We definitely wanted to salvage some pride for British tennis.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们当然想为英国网球挽回一些尊严。

sentence.Network_en: The expectant mothers that Amy had encountered positively glowed with pride.
sentence.Network_cn: 埃米遇见的准妈妈们个个洋溢着自豪和喜悦。

jx.jx_en_mean: a person or thing of which one is very proud and which is a source of great pleasure

lj.lj_ly: the car was his pride and joy.
lj.lj_ls: 那部车是他最得意的东西。

phrase.cizu_name: pride goes (或 comes) before a fall

jx.jx_en_mean: (proverb)if you're too conceited or self-important, something will happen to make you look foolish
the most prominent or important position among a group of things
jx.jx_cn_mean: 最醒目的位置；最重要的地位

lj.lj_ly: the certificate has pride of place on my wall.
lj.lj_ls: 那张证书占着我墙上最醒目的位置。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Old English prȳde 'excessive self-esteem', variant of prȳtu, prȳte, from prūd (see proud)

encyclopedia.content: pride是日本的一部反映冰球运动员团结拼搏的电视连续剧，故事以日本蓝蝎子冰球队的队长halu为主人翁，再现了冰球运动员们在球场上靠威风八面，协作共战的拼斗最终赢得比赛的胜利；也刻画了他们每个人在生活和恋爱中的不同方式和曲折经历，观后让人有很大的震撼力和真实感。

entry.def: Pride is a feeling of satisfaction which you have because you or people close to you have done something good or possess something good.

example.ex: ...the sense of pride in a job well done...
example.tran: 做好一项工作的自豪感

example.ex: We take pride in offering you the highest standards...
example.tran: 我们为向您提供最高标准的服务而感到自豪。

entry.def: Pride is a sense of the respect that other people have for you, and that you have for yourself.

example.ex: Davis had to salvage his pride...
example.tran: 戴维斯必须得挽回他的自尊。

example.ex: It was a severe blow to Kendall's pride.
example.tran: 这严重地打击了肯德尔的自尊心。

entry.def: Someone's pride is the feeling that they have that they are better or more important than other people.

example.ex: His pride may still be his downfall.
example.tran: 他的傲慢可能还会毁了他。

entry.tran: 为…感到自豪；对…感到得意
entry.def: If you pride yourself on a quality or skill that you have, you are very proud of it.

example.ex: Smith prides himself on being able to organise his own life...
example.tran: 史密斯对能够把自己的生活安排得井井有条感到很得意。

example.ex: Doyle prides himself on his accuracy.
example.tran: 道尔为自己的准确无误感到自豪。

entry.def: A pride of lions is a group of lions that live together.
Someone or something that is your pride and joy is very important to you and makes you feel very happy.

example.ex: The bike soon became his pride and joy.
example.tran: 这辆自行车很快就成了他的骄傲。

entry.tran: 首要地位；最重要的地位
entry.def: If something takes pride of place, it is treated as the most important thing in a group of things.

example.ex: A three-foot-high silver World Championship cup takes pride of place near a carved wooden chair...
example.tran: 一个3英尺高的世界锦标赛银质奖杯放在一把木雕椅附近，位置非常显眼。

example.ex: The manifesto gives pride of place to job creation.
example.tran: 这项宣言将创造工作机会放在首位。

entry.tran: 放下自尊；忍气吞声；放下架子
entry.def: If you swallow your pride, you decide to do something even though you think it will cause you to lose some respect.

example.ex: No doubt his old mother would now swallow her pride and go and live with Gladys.
example.tran: 无疑，他的老母亲如今只能放下身价，去和格拉迪斯住在一起。

means.word_mean: 1. a feeling of self-respect and personal worth

sentences.sentence: "he takes pride in his son's success"

means.word_mean: 3. the trait of being spurred on by a dislike of falling below your standards
5. unreasonable and inordinate self-esteem (personified as one of the deadly sins)

sentences.sentence: "He prides himself on making it into law school"

sentences.en: His pride in his achievements is justified.
sentences.cn: 他为自己的成就而自豪, 这是理所当然的。

sentences.en: Having to accept the money was a blow to my pride.
sentences.cn: 我不得不接受这笔钱, 这是对我的自尊心的打击。

sentences.en: He has far too much pride.

jushi.english: Her pride in her achievements is justified.
jushi.chinese: 她为自己的成就而自豪,这是理所当然的。

jushi.chinese: 人们夸他的新汽车时,他得意得很。
